featured.text: Once thought to be extremely rare, synesthesia is now found to affect about one to four percent of the population.
An extremely mild winter allowed more mosquitoes than usual to survive, while the unusually high temperatures in that scorching summer further increased their number by speeding up their life cycle.
Recent studies indicate that the two halves of the brain—the right hemisphere and the left hemisphere — play extremely important roles in learning and communicating.
Interviewer: You’re the older brother of Rahm, the mayor of Chicago, and Ari, an extremely successful talent agent.

definition.en_def: To a very high degree; exceedingly.
definition.example: She was extremely happy with her exam results.
